text:
e="preserve">Frank W. Bolle (June 23, 1924 – May 12, 2020) was an American comic-strip artist, comic book artist and illustrator. He was best known as the longtime artist of the newspaper strips "Winnie Winkle" and "The Heart of Juliet Jones". He also drew for comic books "Tim Holt" and "Doctor Solar, Man of the Atom". He was the illustrator for the Boy Scouts of America magazine "Boys' Life" for 18 years.
Bolle died May 12, 2020 in Weston, Connecticut at the age of 95.

annotations.surface_form: Doctor Solar, Man of the Atom
